metadata.title: CVE-2016-5097 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: phpMyAdmin before 4.6.2 places tokens in query strings and does not arrangefor them to be stripped before external navigation, which allows remoteattackers to obtain sensitive information by reading (1) HTTP requests or(2) server logs.

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
